recipe.name: Classic Ratatouille
recipe.description: A traditional French Provençal stew made with a medley of late summer vegetables like eggplant, zucchini, bell peppers, and tomatoes, simmered in olive oil and herbs until tender and flavorful.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Red bell pepper, seeded and chopped into 1/2-inch pieces
Yellow bell pepper, seeded and chopped into 1/2-inch pieces

steps: Place the chopped eggplant in a colander and sprinkle with sea salt. Set aside for 20 minutes to draw out moisture. After 20 minutes, pat the eggplant dry with paper towels.

Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the eggplant and cook, stirring occasionally, until tender and lightly browned, about 10-15 minutes. Remove the eggplant from the skillet and set aside.

In the same skillet, heat an additional tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat. Add the chopped zucchini and cook until tender but not mushy, about 5-8 minutes. Remove the zucchini from the skillet and set aside with the eggplant.

Add the remaining tablespoon of olive oil to the skillet. Sauté the chopped onions and bell peppers until softened, about 7-10 minutes. Add the minced garlic and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes until fragrant.

Return the cooked eggplant and zucchini to the skillet with the onion, bell peppers, and garlic. Stir in the chopped tomatoes, white wine vinegar, fresh thyme, a pinch of sugar, and red pepper flakes. Season with sea salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste.
Simmer the mixture over low heat, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are tender and the flavors have melded together, about 20-30 minutes.
Remove the skillet from heat and stir in the chopped fresh basil. Taste and adjust seasoning as needed.
Serve the ratatouille warm or at room temperature, drizzled with a bit of extra-virgin olive oil and accompanied by crusty bread.
